intro: Clutia affinis, commonly known as the African velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its velvety, hairy leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, often found in disturbed soils in tropical and subtropical regions. Its flowers are small and clustered, usually in shades of yellow or green, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Clutia affinis is often considered a weed in agricultural settings due to its rapid growth and adaptability.
